title: Backstop compromise is still on, but trade issue could yet derail Brexit agreement
text:
So, “Le Crunch” is now on. For weeks there was widespread doubt in Brussels and EU capitals about whether Boris Johnson could really risk trying to seek a genuine compromise with the EU over Brexit and Northern Ireland. That has now changed.

For months his Government contested Theresa May’s pledge that Brexit could not create the return of any border with Ireland, arguing that a border could be managed with technology, or “alternative arrangements”. The EU said this approach was not serious.

Mr Johnson has now dropped that position and, having conceded the need for customs checks in the Irish Sea, he is left searching for a hybrid solution that enables him to simultaneously keep his promise to...
